intro: Guettarda myrtoides, commonly known as the golden trumpet or false myrtle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
